sources.title: Romance on the Run
sources.description: The film begins with a super-valuable necklace being stolen and the owner of the insurance company is fretting about how to pay off his client's claim. When a man with a shady past, Barry Drake, recovers the stones for the insurance company, everyone seems happy until they discover that it is a fake. Most of the rest of the film consists of Barry and the insurance office assistant going on a cross-country adventure trying to find the real necklace. sources.title: Romance on the Run
sources.description: Title: Romance on the Run Summary: A man has the knack for finding stolen items. Then returns them to the insurance company. Finds some fake jewels and turns them in. Antics ensue. Directed by: Gus Meins Actors: Donald Woods, Patricia Ellis, Grace Bradley Production Company: Republic Pictures (I) Release Date: 11 May 1938 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 A man has the knack for finding stolen items. Then returns them to the insurance company. Finds some fake jewels and turns them in. Antics ensue.

sources.title: Romance On The Run (1938) MYSTERY
sources.description:
Stars: Donald Woods, Patricia Ellis, Grace Bradley 
 Director: Gus Meins

 A  shady private detective specializing in recovering highly insured items gets involved in recovering a stolen necklace and some ladies.

metadata.Plot: A man has the knack for finding stolen items. and then returns them to the insurance company. Finds some fake jewels and turns them in. Antics ensue.
metadata.Actors: Donald Woods, Patricia Ellis, Grace Bradley
